alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Coastal Atlantic; Coastal Ocean; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 7:28PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Atlantic and south central Ocean Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 728 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pomona, or 7 miles northwest of Atlantic City, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Atlantic City, Pleasantville, Brigantine, Northfield, Absecon, Tuckerton, Port Republic, Pomona, New Gretna, Mystic Island and Linwood. This includes the following highways... Garden State Parkway between mile markers 32 and 52. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 4 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southern New Jersey.
